quiz.title: Grade 12 Advanced Mechanics
quiz.subtitle: Unit 1, Quiz 11: Rotational Kinetic Energy & Rolling
quiz.subject: Physics

questions.question: A solid sphere (I = 0.4 MR²) and a hollow sphere (I = 0.67 MR²) roll from rest down the same incline. What is the ratio of their translational velocities (v_solid / v_hollow) at the bottom?
An object rolling without slipping has a total kinetic energy of K. If its rotational kinetic energy is exactly 1/3 of its total kinetic energy, what is the object's shape factor (β)?
A cylinder (I = 0.5 MR²) rolls up an incline with an initial velocity v. To what maximum vertical height h will it rise before stopping?
questions.explanation: $Mgh = 0.75 Mv^2$. Solving for $h$ gives $0.75 v^2 / g$.

questions.question: A flywheel is accelerated from rest by a constant torque. If it reaches an angular velocity ω after 10 revolutions, what was the total work done by the torque?
In the 'Pure Rolling' framework, why does the friction force perform zero work on the rolling object?
options: The point of contact has zero instantaneous velocity relative to the surface.
Friction is non-existent in pure rolling.
The normal force cancels the work done by friction.
The displacement of the center of mass is perpendicular to friction.
questions.explanation: Work is defined as $\int F \cdot ds$. In pure rolling, $ds = 0$ for the point of contact at the moment the force is applied.

questions.question: If the total kinetic energy of a rolling hoop (β=1) is 100 J, how much of that energy is translational?
questions.explanation: For a hoop, $K_{trans} = K_{rot}$. Thus, $K_{trans} = 0.5 K_{total} = 50$ J.

questions.question: A solid disk (β=0.5) is transitioning from sliding (v_i) on ice to rolling (v_f) on a rough surface. If energy is conserved, find v_f/v_i.
The work-energy theorem for rotation states that the net work done by all torques acting on a rigid body is equal to the change in its:
A uniform ball rolls without slipping. What fraction of its total kinetic energy is rotational?
questions.explanation: Fraction $= \beta / (1 + \beta)$. For a solid sphere, $\beta = 0.4 = 2/5$. Fraction $= (2/5) / (7/5) = 2/7$.

questions.question: An object's radius of gyration is k. If it rolls without slipping, find the ratio of translational to rotational kinetic energy.

scoreMessages.90: Mastery Level — You have a superior understanding of Rotational Energy and Rolling dynamics.
scoreMessages.70: Strong Knowledge — You are proficient in energy partitioning; review Work-Energy theorem for rotation.
scoreMessages.50: Developing — Practice the relationship between β and velocity ratios on inclines.
scoreMessages.0: Needs Review — Focus on the fundamental definitions of translational vs. rotational kinetic energy.
